According to the legend, being able to untie the Gordian knot meant to become the ruler of the whole of Asia. However, it was not so easy to cope with a complex knot made from cornel bark. For a long time it could not be done by anyone. The great commander, when went inside the Temple of Zeus, took his sword out and cut the knot.
Some of the ancient writers, who wrote memoirs about the campaigns of Macedonian, believe that he really untied it, solving a difficult problem.

theme.name: Armies and commanders
theme.description: Commanders have repeatedly changed the course of history. The most interesting facts about famous commanders and their armies!

questions.question: What did drivers of first cars fear to puncture  tires with?
questions.description:
Cars gradually replaced horse-drawn carriages. But horses did not allow the first drivers to drive safely for a long time…
Soon machines for trash collection on the road came to aid. There were large electromagnets inside of them. However, regardless of their existence, the problem prevailed for a long time.

questions.question: You will be surprised to learn that American William Phelps Eno, who was the creator of the first traffic laws, ...
questions.description:
The need for traffic rules came with an increase of the number of cars on the road. And with the increasing number of road accidents and traffic jams.
Already in 1900s, William proposed the use of traffic rules to alleviate the situation on the roads. And then he came up with the first ever roundabout. Moreover, William Phelps himself had no idea about how to drive a car.

questions.question: In Dresden (Germany), there is a traffic light, which has been on with… for about forty years.
questions.description: Red traffic light in Dresden is the usual sign of "right turn only". It does not allow drivers to move straight or to the left at the intersection with the street Tsigelshtrasse. Then a logical question arises: why not to put the usual sign? The answer is simple - it is forbidden by law. The argument is that if there is a traffic light installed at the intersection, then it must also be installed on the street extending from the intersection.

questions.question: Traffic jams is a trouble of big cities. For example, in Beijing a 62 miles road section was jammed for …
questions.answer2: A little more than a day
questions.description: Roadworks and trucks with coal caused a huge traffic jam on the China National Highway 110 (G110) in 2010. Drivers call it the longest in history. According to the testimony of participants of the event, they were driving for at least 5 days.

questions.question: In the Indonesian capital Jakarta, an interesting law was passed because of huge traffic jams on the roads. During rush hours, the only cars that were allowed to drive were the ones, which had at least ...
questions.answer1: Two liters (half a gallon) of drinking water
questions.description:
Since 1992, there has been a new type of service in Jakarta – a passenger for hire. Indeed, in some central streets during rush hours it was not allowed to have less than three passengers in the same car. These so-called "jockeys" managed to earn about 15 dollars per day.
Such way of income was very popular amongst women with young children, sometimes with infants. They were considered as two, however, they were paid as if they were one person.

questions.question: In some European countries it is easier to change the country of residence, than to pay a fine for a traffic accident. What do you think determines the amount of a fine in Finland?
questions.description: You will be interested to learn that in Finland, perpetrators of particularly serious accidents are dealt with very strictly. Penalties in such cases are charged as a percentage of revenue specified in declaration. There was a case, when a person was fined an amount of 170 thousand euros for speeding.

questions.question: In Michigan (USA), a fine of 200 thousand dollars was recorded, which was paid by the perpetrator 4 years later after a small car accident. What do you think the defendant was guilty of according to the victim?
questions.answer1: Family breakup and change of sexual orientation
questions.answer2: Panic fear of controlling a car
questions.description: The victim driver wanted to receive compensation for a loss of his family life after 4 years since his car accident. According to him, as a result of the accident, he did not only leave his wife, but also became gay.

questions.question: The "Tinker Bell" effect, which is well-known in the west, is a kind of instilled belief in non-existent. In your opinion, how this effect affects drivers?
questions.description:
The effect of a "Tinker Bell" gained its popularity in theatrical productions of "Peter Pan". Spectators were convinced that if they did not applaud and did not believe in fairy, then she would die. And the audience applauded ... 
The same mental effect is common among drivers. When people are massively convinced that driving is not dangerous - they believe in it. As a consequence, people start to drive a vehicle without special attention, causing harm to themselves and others.

questions.question: The Soviet circus, which was once performing in Stuttgart (Germany), proved that even bears can ride motorcycles. Do you know how Germans rewarded the bear?
questions.answer1: They gave her a real driving license
questions.answer2: They named a motorcycle model in her honor
questions.description:
The bear impressed the German public with his skillful driving so much that she even received a real driving license for it. And after 10 years, when she arrived on tour again, she was allowed to drive through the city.
You'd be surprised, but the bear drove a few blocks, and even slowed down on red. Although, she crashed into the "Mercedes" at the end, it was not her fault.

questions.question: There are countries that treat drunk drivers much more loyally than sober ones. Which country specifically are we talking about?
questions.description: In most countries the capture of a person whilst driving drunk would lead to suspension of a driving license and a huge fine. But not in Uruguay. Here, alcohol can play in your favor, and even mitigate the punishment.

questions.question: The Singapore Government is sympathetic to the elderly population and disabled persons. They even have a special card for...
questions.description: It will not be difficult to extend green light at a pedestrian crossing in Singapore. A special social card is needed to do this. It allows you to add up to 13 seconds to green light. You just need to touch a special reader with it.

questions.question: In Japan, musical roads were constructed for the entertainment of tourists. In your opinion, what is their purpose in South Korea?
questions.answer1: Not to allow drivers to fall asleep at the wheel
questions.description:
You probably wonder how musical highway works... It's simple: furrows of different depths are arranged on a road at different distances from each other. Having passed the way at a certain speed, the vibration from a furrow gets inside a car through tires. It turns into a melody inside a car.
This was not done just for fun in South Korea. In this way, local authorities are trying to protect drivers from falling asleep when driving on particularly long and same type road sections.

questions.question: Hugs transmit a strong emotional condition to another person. But what happens in a human body, when a person hugs someone?
questions.answer2: Heartbeat increases and blood pressure rises
questions.description:
To hug someone does not simply mean to touch a person, or your favourite animal, or even a toy. At the moment of such a non-verbal communication the "hugging hormone" – oxytocin – is produced. Thanks to it, we feel warmth and tenderness when hugging someone.
 Psychologist Matt Hertenstein said: «Interaction with other people is really based on the biological processes".

questions.question: According to average statistical data, hug lovers spend about … per month hugging.
questions.description:
According to statistics, each one of us can spend an hour a month hugging. According to scientists' approximate calculations, it is not as little as it may seem: there are 720 hours in a month, 240 of which we spend sleeping, 240 spend working and the same amount of time is left for cuddling.
 Did you know that a hug usually lasts for 10 seconds? Thus, calculations show that you are being hugged around 360 times a month!

questions.question: In your opinion, what is happening with the pressure of a man, when he hugs someone?
questions.description:
Hugging does not only improve your mood, but also has a positive impact on physical health.
When you feel a touch on your skin, pressure receptors - Cause's corpuscles, which send a signal to the vagus nerve, - get activated. Waves of this nerve, which regulate a lot of things going on in our body, are responsible for lowering blood pressure.

questions.question: Mata Amritanandamayi, who is a Hindu spiritual leader, erected to a rank of a saint by many of her followers, is also referred to as...
questions.description:
Mata Amritanandamayi, also known as the "hugging mother", from a young age began hugging different people without any reason for that. She was constantly punished by her parents for that, since according to the rules, an Indian girl is not allowed to touch strangers, especially men.
She refused to be married and established her ashram and charitable organization that builds shelters and hospitals around the world. Almost every day, hundreds of people get into the arms of Mata.
You will not believe, but according to representatives of her organization, she has already hugged more than 30 million people.

questions.question: According to scientists' researches, "cuddles" even with a teddy bear significantly reduce the fear of...
questions.description: The magazine called Psychological Science published an article about a study of fear and self-confidence, which included the conclusions of experts, stating that  hugs and touches seriously reduce the fear of death. Thanks to hugs, existential fears (fear of future changes, open or closed spaces, fear of unknown, fear of going mad or losing control) are reduced.

questions.question: The survey, conducted among American households, found that a marriage lasts longer in those families where spouses...
questions.answer1: Hug the same cat each time
questions.answer2: Touch each other on regular basis
questions.description: According to an opinion poll, there was an amazing dependency on hugging identified among Americans. Experts identified that if spouses often hug and touch each other, their marriage lasts much longer than in those families where physical contact is minimized or completely absent.

questions.question: Science proved that even a short session of hugging has a positive effect on...
questions.description:
Hugging with your beloved ones is a healing for heart pressure, both literally and figuratively. Even 20 seconds are enough to significantly reduce the damage that stress causes to the cardiovascular system and the whole body.
 University of North Carolina (USA) conducted an experiment: people were divided into groups, which were discussing the recent unpleasant events in the life of each person.
 In one group people were hugged before being questioned that increased heart rate by only 5 points when having conversations, inducing negative emotions. Such an increase in heart rate was half less than in the group without hugging.

questions.question: Danes Monica and Lars Schmidt set a record for the duration of the hug in the beginning of 2016. It was...
questions.description:
The news publishing house The Local in February 2016 announced a new world record for the longest hug. It was established by Danes Monica and Lars Schmidt and was 40 hours 43 minutes 47 seconds.
 In this way they surpassed the previous record set in 2013 that belonged to a British couple Saunders Jones and Mikey Lear. Their hug lasted 25 hours 22 minutes and 36 seconds.

It supports well-being and facilitates the feeling of loneliness. The reason for this is that in old age the feeling of abandonment and social exclusion increases the level of stress.

questions.description:
«Free Hugs» is a very popular movement in the world:  its members  offer hugs to strangers with no remuneration at all.

questions.answer1: You can pay a substantial fine

Public expressions of feelings are the acts of physical intimacy, which in a certain number of countries are considered as acts of indecency.

 And in Iran and the UAE, for kissing in public you can get to jail for a few months.

questions.question: It's always good when you get a hug! And what does such a dream represent to those, who believe in signs?
questions.description:
For all those, who like to interpret dreams, there is good news. If you had a dream, that you are being huged by someone, then  a successful period in your life is just around the corner. This is true only under condition that those hugs please you.

questions.question: Do you know what pagan holiday is considered to be a predecessor of Valentine's Day?
questions.description:
The British and French historians of the XVII - XVIII centuries believed that Valentine's Day originates from the Roman Lupercalia. This fertility celebration dates back to the III century BC. It was held in honor of the goddess Juno Februata and the god Faun - also known as Lupercus.
Rome had a very high infant mortality rate during these centuries. Lupercalia, which was held annually on February 15, was a kind of ritual for increasing fertility. The legendary place, where a she-wolf suckled the founders of Rome - Romulus and Remus - was used as the venue for the celebration. And the name "Lupercalia" comes from the Latin word Magnifier, which means "she-wolf".
 On this day, a sacrifice, in the form of goats and dogs, was brought to the sacred altar. Men cut animals’ skins and, having undressed themselves, ran around the town, whipping women met on the way. It was believed that those whips would give women fertility.

questions.question: It turns out that the legend of the Valentine's Day celebration goes back to the name of one of the two Valentines. Do you know why they were both sentenced to death?
questions.description:
The legend of the origin of the celebration links it to the early Christian martyrs such as Valentine of Rome and Valentine Interamnsky, who both lived in the II-III centuries. There are many stories about their lives. However, the most important historical references indicate that both of them were engaged in secret marriages of couples.
The most common version of the legend says that marriages were forbidden at that time by Roman Emperor Claudius II. He believed that single men are more dexterous at battles. Priest Valentine, who sympathised young couples, secretly consecrated marriages at nights. Subsequently, he was seized by the authorities and sentenced to death. While in prison, Valentine met with Julia, who was the prison guard's daughter. Before the execution, which took place on February 14, 269, the priest passed a note to his beloved one, which included a declaration of love and a signature, which said: "Your Valentine".

questions.question: During the last years of the V century, Lupercalia was canceled and Pope Gelasius announced a new celebration, which had Saint Valentine as its patron. Nowadays, Valentine's Day is celebrated in almost every part of the globe. Do you know how this celebration is called in Estonia?
questions.description:
Let us look into America at the beginning of the XX century. People were very generous with regards to gifts and presented their beloved ones with marzipans, which were quite expensive.
In Japan, for example, Valentine's Day appeared only in the 30s of the XX century. Chocolate became one of the most popular gifts there as a result of huge supplies coming from a big chocolate producing company. Chocolate is still quite popular there on this day.
In France, for example, it is more common to present jewelry. And in Denmark, you can get white dried flowers as a romantic present.
As for Estonia and Finland, they know this celebration as "Friendship Day". All citizens - regardless of sex and age - give each other greeting cards and other pleasant things.

questions.question: You will be interested to learn that every year on the eve of Valentine's Day more than 1,000 letters come to the house in Verona (Italy), where Romeo and Juliet lived. All these letters are addressed to their greatest love. When did love letters, known as valentines, appear?
questions.description:
Tradition to present familiar to many of us heart-shaped cards dates back to the XV century.
It is believed that the very first valentine was the message of Charles I of Orleans to his wife. It was sent from the prison – the Tower of London – in 1415, where the Duke spent 25 years. After three centuries, in the XVIII century, valentines reached mass distribution.
 Nowadays, these love cards, symbolizing love and devotion, have a lot of variations in terms of appearance. However, their traditional color is red or pink.

questions.question: The tradition of celebrating Valentine's Day as Day of beloved ones appeared due to the ...
questions.description:
It is believed that there was no literature evidence that Valentine's Day existed before the references of the "father of English literary language" Geoffrey Chaucer in his poem "Parlement of Foules".
The first literature evidence of it as a romantic event appeared in 1382. The poem "Parlement of Foules" was devoted to the anniversary of the engagement of King Richard II and Anne of Bohemia. It contained the following line: "For this was on seynt Volantynys day Whan euery bryd comyth there to chese his make". Which literally translated as: "And it was on Valentine's Day, when every bird chooses its soulmate".
Reference to this day can also be found in the Shakespeare's tragedy "Hamlet", written in 1600 – 1601, which has the following line: "Tomorrow is Saint Valentine’s day, All in the morning betime, And I a maid at your window, To be your Valentine".

questions.question: Did you know that in Saudi Arabia the celebration of Valentine's Day is ...
questions.description: As much as it may seem strange, but there are countries that do not celebrate Valentine's Day. Those who still dare to take risks and break the law - will be fined and the size of the fine is not small…

questions.question: It is believed that sometimes your present can tell more about your feelings towards a person than your words. This architectural masterpiece, created back in the middle of the XVII century, exists intact today. It became the personification of the eternal and true love. Construction, which began in 1634, lasted 22 years and more than 20 thousand workers were involved. Even Persians, who plundered and destroyed Delhi, did not dare to come close to the palace of the deceased.
Another well-known gift to the beloved woman was a plantation of cactuses, which are used to make tequila. It was gifted to Bonnie by her lover - a bank robber - Clyde. However, the documents confirming the ownership, were not found.

questions.question: What did the phrase "to wear your heart on your sleeve", which arose in the Middle Ages, mean?
questions.answer1: Wearing traces of blood on a sleeve
questions.answer2: Wearing spouse's name on a sleeve
questions.description:
There is a well-known English expression "to wear your heart on your sleeve". It is believed that it appeared in the Middle Ages and is associated with Valentine's Day celebration.
According to the legend, on this day girls and guys threw paper sheets, which had different names written on them, into a jug. Paper sheets with a name on them, were randomly picked from a jug and the name that was on paper was considered to be the name of betrothed. It was believed that after that you should wear the name on your sleeve for a week.

questions.answer2: It was a coup of European PR-company

In ancient times, people believed that each person's soul is saved in the heart. For example, Greeks believed that love came from the heart, when Amur’s arrow (as for Romans it was Cupid's arrow) got into it.

questions.question: What may surprise tourists in Jamaica on Valentine's Day?
questions.description:

It is much more fun In Jamaica! Here, people can witness a special kind of wedding – the naked wedding – on Valentine's Day. According to the tradition, the only "clothing" that bride and groom should have on are their wedding rings...
